Reviews.Content: Honestly, when it comes to big rooms who really uses all the space. I sure don't. That's why I liked the Max. The rooms - yeah they are small. But what are you looking for. I thought the amenities were good - liked the pillow ordering service. Great sleep in this hotel! Though $6.00 for water was a bit much I did enjoy my stay. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: centre_ice05
Reviews.Content: Well you are likely to get ripped off no matter what hotel you stay in downtown of any city, hotel max makes it an art. No free wifi (this really makes me mad, as every hostel and motel I've ever stayed in has FREE wifi... What a concept! No they want 12 bucks a day). Parking was 35 dollars per night. They bed was one of the most uncomfy I've ever slept on, the walls were paper thin and there was a screaming seagull's nest outside our window which made it hard to sleep and the shower was a super cramped cell (and I'm 5 ft 3 in) with a opaque shower curtain that made it almost pitch black in there. Save your money and get a private room in a hostel! The location was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMKE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Max for three nights and loved every one of them! We were in room 807 which is a corner room with a view of the Needle and were able to watch the Blue Angel whiz past during Seafair weekend. The room was with a very comfy king bed and some of the best pillows we ever had in a hotel. Our bathroom was a perfect size and we did not encounter any space issues, there was plenty of room. The location is great and the staff was fantastic. We highly recommend Hotel Max and would stay there again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a solid stay at the Hotel Max”
Reviews.Author: dewey25
Reviews.Content: Great hotel centrally located in downtown Seattle.. they have some of the more reasonable rates in an expensive City. We just stayed this past weekend and because we're from Vancouver we qualified for an offer that includes Free parking and $20 breakfast voucher each day at the restaurant.. Very friendly staff who aim to please..

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: janeingrid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on 8/4/11 while we were in town for a wedding. We chose Hotel Max because of the location, the price, and the reviews. We prepaid for our room, which gave us a discount. It was $200. I've read other reviews which quoted prices much lower than that, so I guess we just chose an expensive time or something. Check in was fine. The elevators were a nightmare. We didn't figure out until the second or third trip in it that you don't push the buttons for your floor, you put your room key in. And that doesn't always work, either. So we spent some time going up and down aimlessly. The room was just fine and what I was expecting. People had said they were small, which they were, but it didn't bother me. I'm just sleeping there, not moving in! In other reviews, people complained quite frequently about the smallness of the bathroom, and again, while certainly not palatial by any stretch of the imagination, were just fine. My knees did not bump into anything, and I'm 5'9". They had nice marble floors and a bathtub and a enough space for my toiletries. What else do you need? The bed and sheets were great! No problems there. There was a flat screen TV as advertised. For what we were paying, there really should have been free wifi. I'd say that and the elevator are the only real "needs improvement" areas. Overall, I was pleased with my stay and should I ever need a place to stay in Seattle again I just may find myself at Hotel Max again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Seattle Honeymoon ... we will be back to celebrate anniversaries”
Reviews.Author: Fussythe1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped from the car, I knew we had made a wonderful choice. The valet was polite and assisted with our bags. Our reservation and check-in was flawless and the room was fabulous! Hotel is located in the center of everything ... Nordstrom's Flagship, Macys, Pike's Public Market, Wonderful Dining all around the area, easy transportation, easy accessibility to the major transportation corridors, and an overall wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best part is the lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: This is a sexy hotel somewhat similar to the Ace but less authentically cool. My room here was tiny with an even tinier bathroom (the smallest I have encountered off an airplane). Most people staying at the same time as us appeared to be in their twenties and thirties and the restaurant was enjoyable with a great deals at happy hour. The front desk called several times to tell us we were being too loud, something that rarely happens at hotels. The location is less desirable than some and most rooms overlook a boring parking lot. The 24hr room service is extremely limited and takes about an hour to arrive. At one point our shower stopped working and we called the front desk who responded about an hour later and made the necessary adjustments. They provide lots of attractively packaged in room items with hefty price tags. If you want something like, say, a razor, call down to the front desk and they should have free onesâ€¦ using the option available in room cost me nearly $20! However, the lobby is glossy, modern and really just too swanky.... it couldn't make a better first impression!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel, great energy: take it to the MAX!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Hotels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Max for one night and wished we were there for a week! THE TEAM is wonderful, they helped us navigate and the directions were simple and brought us right to the front door where the valet greeted us and had an energizing conversation with my fiancÃ© about soccer -it was the perfect welcome, everyone at Hotel Max is genuinely friendly. THE ROOM we stayed in was a king room -they did a fantastic job with the space in the room, it was stylish, simple and had beautiful artwork. The best partâ€¦ the robes, you could live in them, they are so comfortable and I have it on my Christmas wish list! The bed was a CLOUD and the room was so quiet you could hear a pin drop, we slept like rocks. THE HOTEL corridors are very sexy with black and white prints on the doors. They did a great job synergizing their concept and really offering a unique experience. The lobby is comfortable as well as modern and outside they have lounge furniture: kind of like an urban resort feel. THE RESTAURANT, Red Fin was perfect we had the late night menu, great menu! we had edamame beans and chilli toasted cashewsâ€¦ delicious perfect late night snack with some wine ;) I am not a fan of cookie cutter chain hotels and aim to stay at interesting and passionate properties and will stay at Hotel Max every time I visit Seattle, as well we will recommend Hotel Max to any friends or family that are taking trips to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but great comfort”
Reviews.Author: katiepenney
Reviews.Content: This feels like a wonderful place for very hip young people. Rooms were wonderfully appointed but tiny. Lighting in the bathroom was poor. Art on doors was wonderful but a bit disorienting. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying in an art gallery."”
Reviews.Author: Teddi76
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hotel Max several times in the past few years. It is a wonderful boutique hotel with a full sized photo on each guest room door. After this welcome, you enter a very brightly decorated room. Each room has a minifridge, a flat screened TV and a bright bathroom. Formerly an old hotel, this has been updated with a very modern scheme. If Japanese food is your passion, you will love dining in Red Fin, the restaurant off the lobby. The Max is well located to go shopping, to Jazz Alley or down to Pike's Place. This is a great little place to stay for your getaway to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MissedConnections
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business. As other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms are small. The bathroom was tiny. Very, very tiny. I'm seen bigger showers in motor homes. The hotel is trying for a cool, hip, boutique feel but not quite hitting the mark. Everything was clean though, and the staff were pleasant. The lounge next door has good drinks and looked like good food too. It's fine for a short stay but the lack of space and amenities gets old real quick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not so nice staff”
Reviews.Author: hihosilver23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and mom for a short vacation. The hotel itself is nice, the rooms are a bit small but from what I gather that is quite common in the downtown area. It was nice to be able to walk everywhere and there are some really good restraunts in the downtown area. The only problem I had was with the check in staff. Our flight arrived very early and we got to the hotel around 11am. We knew our rooms probably weren't going to be ready but we stopped by to drop our luggage off. When we arrived they took our phone number and said they'd call when the rooms were ready. We went out for the day and decided to check back at about 2:30 just to see if they were close to being done. There was a different girl at the counter, who very bluntly said that she had our number and she would call us when the rooms are ready. She seemed very put out that we would be checking on the rooms when clearly she was planning on calling us. So, we went down the street and had a coffee, waiting for the call. We were very tired at this point having gotten up before 6am to catch our flight and were purley killing time waiting for the call. At 3:30pm I finally walked back to the hotel and asked what time check in was. The girl then says 3:00pm at which point I then asked if our rooms were ready. She says yes. Later when we were finally getting checked in my mom asked why we never recieved a phone call, and the girl just says "oh well your rooms just got finished". Clearly check in is 3pm and she just never called us on time. We all had the distinct feeling that our rooms were ready much earlier but that they were trying to make a point, since every morning the cleaning staff was knocking at our door between 8:30 and 9:00am. Other than that we had a great trip and the hotel was nice, I just thought their customer service should have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Strange place”
Reviews.Author: beachfront914
Reviews.Content: Great location near fancy shopping, but very cheaply decorated to disguise the age of the building. They basically painted everything black and red and turned the lights way down to try and fool you that it is a trendy boutique hotel. It is not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, chic artsy hotel...horribly small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cincycaddy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Max is neat in the funky colors and decor. The location is fantastic but the rooms really disappoint in regards to size. For the price point these rooms are at (retail - we paid $75/night via Priceline Name Your Own Price) Beds are comfortable. We had a room with a queen bed, desk and mini-fridge packed with honor-bar overpriced items. Shower is a separate closet. Bathroom has a toilet and a very small sink. No room to keep toiletries or apply makeup. We had 2 suitcases and 2 carry on totes. Barely enough room for one suitcase. Small closet didn't help things. Overall this is not a 3.5 star hotel. More likely a 2.5 star. Yes it is updated. Yes it is chic with it's artsy walls and decorations. The location is great (except for close proximity to the Greyhound station) but the rooms are way to small for this price point.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: williamsonbr
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Max has a great location and very nice amenities. The room isn't the largest in the world, but it was very well designed and decorated. It has to be the best value in downtown Seattle. The hotel has a pretty hip look and furnishings. But even though I just turned 50, I appreciated the atmosphere and overall vibe.

Reviews.Title: “What is Hip?”
Reviews.Author: DJSlalom
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times - initially due to the low winter prices. It's easy to get to from the end of the Light Rail from SeaTac airport - just a short couple of blocks from the last station. Summer rates are too high for the tiny rooms; at least the beds are super comfortable. My main complaint is the tiny shower - what is hip about a shower stall that can't possibly be shared? Also, the excellent japanese fusion restaurant attached closes too early for late arrivals - go to the end of the alley to the west of the hotel to find an elegant late night italian-style fine dining option. Lasty, high charges for Wi-Fi (still!?) and use of the business center computer, and $30 parking, have driven me elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jaaldrid1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went on an Alaskan cruise out of Seattle and we stayed at the Hotel Max the Saturday night prior to our embarkation. We chose the hotel because of it's reasonable price and proximity to points of interest (Pike Place Market, Space Needle, Seattle Center). Our room was small but well-appointed; perfectly comfortable for 2 people. The hotel decor was artistic and quirky. We were able to walk to Pike Place Market within 5-10 minutes and to the Space Needle within 15-20 minutes. We utilized the fitness center which was small but effective. The hotel has a connecting sushi restaurant. We had dinner here and were not disappointed. The food and drinks were delicious. I highly recommend the "ginger manhattan".

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: goldjacket
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a very cool place. The rooms are pretty small but the hotel has cool decor. We arrived to a room that wasn't cleaned or made up from the last guest. Dirty towels on the floor, bed wasn't made, coffee in the cups. They sent a cleaning crew up immediately and took care of it. They also gave us the room for free which was great and what we would expect from a hotel that costs 200.00 USD a night. Therefore, we were happy and more than understanding of the mistake. It was in a great location. A pleasant stay and the staff was really helpful with our luggage when we showed up a bit early to site see. The cleaning crew also made a point to ship a pair of shoes we forgot, although we paid for shipping, we did get the shoes returned which was important.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel is great location”
Reviews.Author: Deldefunk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is modern and funky with character. It is close to all the shopping and walking distance to the main sites. We got the train to the airport early morning and it was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: janosbuzmeg
Reviews.Content: The valet notified us of a flat tire on our rental car close to our flight dparture time and offered to change the spare without hesitation. Without his help we would have missed our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Not a traditional hotel, more like a tidy crash pad. Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: SeaWaGal
Reviews.Content: Seasoned business travelers or people looking for usual hotel amenities will probably be disappointed with this supposed 3 1/2 star hotel. I would say that is grossly inflated and it more on par with 2 1/2 star hotels. That said, the location is great for tourists or people who plan to be out all day sightseeing and yet are centrally located and don't need a car. The "hotel" manages to add a bit of fun/ playfulness, if you are on vacation that might be a perk. If you travel with a car prepare on spending about $30 a night to park here. With the price I paid on Hotwire, I was okay with it. But this place feels more like a private room in a hostel, than a hotel. It is kinda a neat "Seattle" and "urban" experience. Especially if you are kinda sheltered and want "an experience" with your lodging. The room is VERY small. but also clean and cute. But don't forget, very small. The front desk clerk seemed a bit unprofessional, but acceptable. The maid walked in on us dressing at 9am, even though we had the "Nope" tag clearly on the door and responded to her knocks. She still walked in. Walked out and then started singing loudly outside the door. If you like this sort of thing, great. The Hotel Max is in a cool older building, that has been revamped with paint and "funky" touches. It can be a neat experience staying here because it's not really like a traditional hotel, but if you want traditional amenities, it isn't that good. The bed was very comfortable. Large TV. Interesting hallways. Hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Way TOO small”
Reviews.Author: marleyboy59
Reviews.Content: Location: Good Service: Good Room: Clean and neat Bathroom: Way Too small My wife is 4'-11" her knees hit the sink,I'm 5'-9" my knees hit the sink, had to sit sideways. Shower was also small. Room# 514 We were only there one night. If we were there longer we would have changed rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteLa_83
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max is located in the heart of downtown Seattle. We searched for hotels for a while before we chose the Max. We ultimately chose it because it was one of the cheapest options, it had the best recommendations and because of its locations. Rooms are not HUGE but certainly the hotel its serve its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaycdavis
Reviews.Content: I love the decor, and the view. I love how close it is to everything downtown. Very easy to find stuff to do. PLUS! It has a sushi bar inside the hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: MissBCD
Reviews.Content: Super trendy hotel in a great location for walking everywhere. Yes the room was super small (we were in 408) BUT how much room do you need when you are either out and about or in bed. Loved the Aveda amenities and the bed was comfy. The bar is cool. The door and bell staff were friendly but the front desk could warm up a bit... Not that they were not friendly just more neutral. This is my new Seattle go-to hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly staff and a fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: maw0512
Reviews.Content: Second time in Seattle, visit family and book this cute hotel. Great location, safe to walk around at night and Lots of restaurants and shopping around here. You can easily take the Link Light Rail from/to Airport to must of the downtown hotels. Last stop and two blocks away to Hotel Max. Service is great and friendly staff. Little boutique hotel, so do not expecting the room will be big. Enough just fit two adult, but if you are two+, I will says you have to book elsewhere....or request/upgrade to a bigger room. Away from the elevator if you are a light sleeper. Pillow Menu is great option for the travelers. Truly boutique, that's all I can say. We booked at expedia with flight package which, this hotel is meet our budget and we knew the room will be small, that's why we were enjoying our stay. Think of NYC. :) Breakfast can be next door (Starbucks). Red Fin Sushi is a great restaurant, be sure go to their happy hour. We had a wonderful trip, hope you will have a great one too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous artsy hotel with an amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: artatwork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an art festival who got the artists a great rate, so I was not sure what I was in for. It's a wonderful, artsy hotel beside a DELICIOUS sushi restaurant, COMFY beds, and a staff to die for. Easy walking distance to Pikes Market, the Needle, Aquarium, Art Museum and many other attractions. I will DEFINITELY stay here again the next time I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, artistic in the heart of downtown Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: PamelaPDX
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Hotel Max, and I would definitely stay there during my next trip to Seattle. The rooms are small but beautiful, comfortable, and quiet. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. Plus, I had a great view of the Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: benst
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle. We found the Hotel Max to be very well located, both near where we needed to drop the hire car off and also near where tours left from, shopping etc. The hotel has been recently renovated and definitely has a theme going on (with pictures of rockbands on every door). We found the room comfortable, although the bathroom was very very small to the point of being a bit of a pain. Still if it's a tradeoff between that and having more space in the main room, I guess they made the right decision. There is also no free wifi in room. Check in and checkout process was painless. There is also a very good happy hour at the restaurant/bar attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the Packaging.”
Reviews.Author: cmayeda
Reviews.Content: Like you, we were doing the same thing. Reading reviews, trying to find the most stars for the least money. Pictures helped too. We eventually came upon this hotel. Sweet decor, contemporary themes, and great reviews. So, we booked. Turned out that the packaging was great, but the substance was just tragic. Oh where to start. How about the moment we pulled up and learned that it was mandatory valet parking if we wanted to take advantage of hotel parking (and the advertised discount). Fine, except I hate valet parking. Already in the minuses. Also interesting was a note in the Hotel Max room info book saying you needed to tell them at least 30 minutes before you leave to have access to your car. More minuses. Throughout the weekend, service was solid. Check in was smooth. After that, we realized the great pictures, the great decor, was about the only part of the hotel that can be considered great. The room made some hotel rooms I've stayed in a country like Japan, look like a Shangri-La penthouse. To say it was tiny would be saying The Bieb's kind of popular. Our first thought when we saw the bathroom: airplane, economy class. A basic law of physics is no two objects can occupy the same space. In our bathroom, that meant the throne, and the sink. I think the designers got distracted with trying to prove that law wrong. Just by looking at it, we knew it would be impossible to sit square on it. No shelves or counters to put things on either. Resulted in knocking toothbrushes and other toiletries off the sad excuse for a glass ledge, and into the toilet and garbage. Not done yet. The bed. GREAT to lie down to nap, or relax. HORRIBLE to actually do what its meant for: to sleep in. The stupid thing was concave and we both woke up tired, sore and did I mention tired from keeping ourselves propped up on the sides. No mattress pad (other than this diaper cloth looking thing). Our Saturday morning started with a startle. Horns, shouting and chants. Turns out the owners of the place also own a hotel in San Fran and are Union dissolvers. A local activist group decided it would be just swell to make us answer for it, and wake us up. I know this was not in the control of the hotel management, but in the end, they have to answer to a unpleasant Saturday morning wake up call. Wi-Fi didn't work, room filled with someone else's cigarette smoke, and the valet parking lost our friends' car. Two plus': Location is great. And the Red Fin restaurant is stellar. Great Happy Hour choices, service, sushi, and great desserts. So it wasn't all bad. Just 98% bad. Oh wait, the restaurant doesn't really count. So, 99% sure that I'll not want to stay at this hotel again. And 100% sure to never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: brodie52
Reviews.Content: You really don't need anything more than this when staying in downtown Seattle. Hotel Max is close to everything and you can walk to all major spots downtown. Hotel Parking is expensive and will help boost what could have been a very good room rate. We didn't find the rooms or the bathroom to be too small after all we were not holding a ball in the bathroom! The room is just the right size if you are using it just to sleep. I don't recall front desk staff being particularly welcoming, helpful or concerned about us or our dog. Hotel Max is pet friendly for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, chic, but "European" sized rooms :)”
Reviews.Author: reddevsfan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max is in a good location, right downtown in just a few minutes from Pike Place Market, great restaurants, etc. It's got a cool rock/music theme, and is a good value. Just be aware, the hotel is a boutique hotel, and has a bit of European sizing, i.e. smaller than Americans may be used to. Depending on the floor you're on, you might have a very, very small bathroom. I was on the 5th floor, but my colleagues on 9th and 10th floors said their bathrooms were small, but not quite as small as mine. All in all, good price, good location, just be prepared for smaller dimensions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with good problem resolution”
Reviews.Author: SusanDallasTexas
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Max to be a design forward, great hotel in a convenient location and good value for the price. Front desk was cooperative to change our room from one bed to two at check in. Room generous size and very clean and well appointed. Great beds and pillows. Elevators small and valet parking service car delivery was chronically slow. Exorbitant charge for wifi made us go to Starbucks for such. Too, we had no caffeinated coffee in the room which was a bummer when we had a 6 am wake up for a 7:30 flight. When we told the front desk however, the parking charges were removed as a gesture of goodwill, which we found to be very good on the spot problem resolution. We would stay at the Hotel Max again.

Reviews.Title: “good - but small rooms and even smaller bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: glg2580
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and comes with free WIFI. The rooms are clean and rather modern. although the rooms are small, the bathroom is unbearably small, roughly 6ft by 4ft. lets just say when you need to use the toilet, you may need to move your legs around the sink. the only other issue is the aircon - heating unit. We went in April and the room did not require any heating but the ventilation (through the window) will hit your face as you lay in bed, making it quite chilly in the middle of the night. I would stay at this hotel again, but I dont think I would stay here longer than a few days. Overall a good hotel and obviously recently refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great staff, regular rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Max a few times now and really like it, the staff are great, the location is great, the decor is great. All I would say is that the standard rooms are quite tiny which makes it difficult if you have any kind of luggage, the last couple of times I was in a corner room or larger room, but this time I was put into a tiny room which just made everything cramped. Nonetheless I would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky”
Reviews.Author: faye_whitaker
Reviews.Content: I came up to Seattle for the weekend with a few friends. We stayed at the Hotel Max because it is close to all the attractions and was recommended by a friend. I am glad we did. The Hotel staff was helpful and always smiling (except our bellman who didn't even wait for a tip). The decorations were fun and individual (different picture on every room door). The room was on the smaller side but still had plenty of space. The bathroom was a bit small, but I understand it's a historic hotel and you have to work with what you have. I even ordered a pillow off the pillow menu. Overall it was a great trip everything in walking distance and watched a movie to put myself to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: Uyenie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great except for their old school air conditioning system which is super loud and lets in a lot of outside noise and their very slow and small elevators. The dining is supurb and the staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Truly lovely hotel experience, can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: EGH1511
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Personable, friendly staff, very comfortable room and bed. Unique character. Ideal location. Great room service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nietosellshomes
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating... Great location, great recomendations... Great service = Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Magoosangel
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying at the Hotel Max. I paid to park in a lot a few blocks away, which was cheaper. The staff was helpful and friendly. Had dinner in the bar and got dry cleaning done. Room was small, but didn't feel that way. No real view from my window but within walking distance to Pikes and other attractions. Close to the space needle and monorail, also.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience..”
Reviews.Author: YLC76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Max for 2 nights from Mar 14 to 16 with my wife and 26 months old baby. My room was on the 5th floor. Seattle was the last stopover during my family's 13 days trip to Vancouver, Victoria Canada and Seattle in WA, and it became the last and the worst experience for my family's long waiting-for travel. I'm writing to let other travelers know about the bad service level at front desk and horrible amenities and facilities of Hotel Max. I have to mention first that there's just one thing that stands out for the Hotel...the location. It's 20 minutes walk to Space Needle and 15 minute's walk to Pike Place Market, so it gets credit especially when I don't want to drive to major attractions in the city center. However, beware of other factors that overweigh the hotel's merits. 1. I read some reviews that say the front desk is kinda funky. But, I would like to say that it's low quality and less professional. And, sometimes it's outrageous. The night before I checked in, I phoned to ask for two beds room rather than one bed room. The guy at front desk seemed busy and put me on hold in line. I waited several minutes and the line was disconnected. When I called back, front desk didn't apologize for disconnection and even giggled when I said the line was disconnected. I made a hotel reservation using one of hotel reservation sites, and, when I asked for two beds room, the front desk said there would be $30 more charge on the original bill, which is $15 per night. I pointed out that in every hotel I stayed before I had the right to choos between two beds room and one bed room. It was quite a hassle to talk about it. And, the front desk was not kind and professional enough in listening to my request on a bed type I prefer. When I said I can't understand the surcharge based on the type of bed, he finally said, "We probably could work things out when you arrive at the hotel tomorrow."... I phoned to make sure about the type of room I would stay, and I coulnd't believe what he's saying...It's hotel policy to hold out important decision until the guest arrives at the hotel?? 2. The guests who have this hotel in mind should be wary of poor amenities and room environment of this hotel. By the time I went to bed, I found that the heater in my room is really loud....Much Louder than you can imagine. I swear that my 2 year old baby and wife couldn't have a good sleep, and had to wake up many times because of loud droning of that Old Fashined Heater...!!...What's unbelievable is that we can't enter or dial a temperature I want for the heater, which made me wake up so many times at night to turn on and off the heater....Just imagine!...You wake up to turn off when the room is hot and wake up again to turn on when the room is too cold...Never expect any automatic system to adjust temperature... 3. What's more surprising was very small bathroom and Very Poor flushing of water.... we had to take every care so that the water doesn't drown out of the toilet. And, we had to pull the lever several times to flush the water...And, even though I found that it's already mentioned in another review, the bathroom is extremely small...I can't even stretch my arms on the bathtub.. I couldn't believe it's the room and bathroom of the 3 and 1/2 star rating hotel...Some good paintings in the room was interesting and creative I would say. But, too many photos on the doors and walls of hotel were rather distracting than attractive. Once again, beware of that old fashioned heater that prevents you from having good sleep and poor quality bathroom that disturbs you everytime you go in there. Once again, I should say the location of hotel is good. But, considering low quality level of front desk service and room amenities, I would never stay here again if I visit my sister in Vancouver again and have another opportunity to make a trip around Seattle area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location and valet parking”
Reviews.Author: ChellinND
Reviews.Content: The last time I was in Seattle was October and the previous year in October as well. Kept seeing Hotel Max on the corner and thought it looked funky and an awesome location close to everything. This much is true. Location cannot be beat. In summer weather, this place is perfect to walk to everything; from the market to the Space Needle and Westlake Center shopping. We stayed Friday to Tuesday am and the valet parking attendants (sorry, but I didn't catch names and hate to label, but there were two African American and one Somalian gentlemen, who were AWESOME!) Front desk was average at best. Looked asleep and the guy who checked us in didn't even tell us that you had to stick the key card into the slot in the elevator to make it go to your floor. After going back and forth, we figured it out...kinda funny. Our room was on the fourth floor facing out to Stewart and it's LOUD. I have stayed all over the country in every major city and this place is LOUD. If you stay here request a room on the other side, or you will never sleep. The walls are so paper thin that we could hear people talking (every word!), having sex (my 15-year old niece got educated.), and taking a shower at 2:00 am and hearing them drop the soap in the shower!!! Not lying...we turned on the window heater/air to drown out noise, but then that was like having an airplane hangar next to you...wow. This is like having your own little efficiency apartment in the middle of downtown Seattle. Yes, it is funky, the art is cool, but that lasts a minute and then you're like...oh no, this is loud and really small. If you are over 6 feet tall, you will have a difficult time using the bathroom. I'm not joking and I think our bathroom was larger than most. My knees almost hit the wall when going potty! The shower wouldn't drain (we asked twice for it to be fixed!) and so by the time you got out you had water ankle deep! Every day we had to ask for more toiletries, since there were three of us and we actually needed them! We weren't taking home for future use...didn't do that. Valet parking is $30, but since we rented a car and it was raining the entire trip, for us it was probably more cost effective, since we could come and go many times and not have to pay. The lot across the street was less expensive, but once you leave, that's it. So for us that could've been $100 easy a day! And the above mentioned valet guys were sweetie pies and talkative and made the whole stay! They should be at the front desk taking care of people...awesome! We ordered room service one night and it was horrible!!! So gross...ordered two sodas and they just slapped the dirty-topped cans on the tray with no glasses of ice. We ordered three separate meals; got one set of cutlery...wha??? Wierd and gross...mistake. Stay else where...hate to say it...really hate to say it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bkafflen
Reviews.Content: Booked through a price-it yourself-online site. Got a great deal of less than $75/night. We stayed for one night. Had to use their valet parking service at an expensive $30 for the overnight. There is a public outside lot directly across the street which I would have used but they require you to move the car by 6 AM; it was only $15-20, I think. The room was small, although they gave us a room overlooking the Space Needle. We were on an odd-numbered floor and they only have ice machines on the even numbers. Had to go down to the check-in desk to find out. The phone in our room never worked either. It would give the dial tone but wouldn't dial whether you used the instant buttons (front desk, concierge, etc.) or the ext. listed... All in all, an average experience that was doable only because of the great deal we got.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: luvlylara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a last minute trip to seattle by recommendation of a friend. The hotel is upscale and modern, and the staff are friendly. Everything was clean and the rooms are great! The robes are amazing here. We did have hit-or-miss hot water in our shower, but overall this place rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Artsy comfort with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gailscout
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our 3 day stay on room 903 at Hotel Max. Conveniently located between downtown and Belltown, with the Westlake Specialty market and Uptown Espresso around the corner. The rooms are small with decent size bathrooms; very comfortable bed, flat screen tv, small refrigerator, coffee pot iron, hairdryer, and small safe. We had a great wide view towards the Space Needle and away from street noise. Other than the small room, the coffee at Red Fin is a poor pick. Mistral Kitchen for dinner is 3 blocks away and be sure to check out the remodeled Cinerama at 4th Ave/Lenora. Probably the classiest theater you've ever stepped in to watch a movie. The velvet seats, terrific surround sound, huge screen, friendly staff and great choice of snacks for your viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Traveler62France
Reviews.Content: Modern design, excellent restaurant (breakfast , lunch and diner) but rooms are very (sorry, very, very) noisy (street and neighbors ) Located in downtown near convention center, about 15min by foot of Seattle Public Market. Staff very welcoming

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Travelgurl45
Reviews.Content: This hotel aims to have a contemporary feel. While it's "hip" it isn't supported by friendly staff. Upon arrival we were asked if we wanted a bigger room or a room higher up. We went for bigger room which was not very big at all. We were also on the 6th floor (hotel only has 10 floors) so I'm not sure what view we really could have had. There was a gross substance on one of our pillows (looked like a melted candy bar). Called front desk and they told us it was just detergent. At the end of our four night stay we asked if we could do a later check out. The lady instantaneously said no, even though they tout that option in their phamplet. Red Fin sushi place is really good, and very fresh. Overall not worth the $150/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Wonderful Service: Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: HeadedOut
Reviews.Content: I would rate Hotel Max with five stars but we just did not sleep very well. Noises from the street woke us every hour. We had a corner room and the views of the city were wonderful, but that is price we paid---two streets, twice the noise. OTHERWISE, we loved the hotel. Will stay again because we know the hotel cannot control the street noise. The staff was outstanding and the restaurant food was great, and room-service breakfast was amazing. Like I say, we will return but shall bring earplugs next time. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Postage stamp with great food”
Reviews.Author: ricknsara
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel and we mean little! The room was quite small yet very functional. It is difficult to get more than 2 people with luggage into the elevator. The art work did not impress us and the black hallways with black and white photo murals on the doors made it way too dark. The walls are very thin and we could hear the people in the next room. The restaurant and bar were very good; the service was hot and cold. Be aware that the sushi bar/kitchen closes at 11:00 despite what the in room literature says. We received a hotel special and our room was $99.00. This was a good price. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. We would stay here again. A nice hotel with a great downtown location for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TLCHOME
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is the rooms are a little tight BUT everything else is fabulous! The atmosphere is a little rock n roll...super plush and sexy 60's style I'm thinking...beds are luxiourious and the staff is incredibly friendly and accomodating! Have also stayed in the sister hotel in Portland Hotel Deluxe ~ just as fab with a different flavor. BTW - my breakfast (scrambled eggs/bacon/hashbrowns/english muffin) was delicious! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, that is our policy”
Reviews.Author: SavonSoin
Reviews.Content: We were always curious about staying that the Hotel Max and decided to go this last weekend. We got on-line and noticed we could get a room in the $90 range. As we tend to be last minute planners, we decided to book directly with the hotel en-route. We called the hotel and said we wanted to book a room tonight and the front desk agent said that they couldn't book a room directly and we had to call the 800 reservations line. He transferred us and we sat outside the Hotel Max for 15 minutes on hold waiting for an agent to pick up. The door / valet knocked on our window and asked us if he could help us - and we told him what was going on. He said that was not normal and we should just go inside and check in and that the desk agent we spoke to must have been wrong. We went inside and met "Brian" at the desk. (Brian doesn't like his job) We said we would like to make a reservation for tonight and we saw on-line that there are rooms available and that they were available in the $90 range per night. Brian then began to tell us that he could not book a room at that price and we would have to pay $139. We pulled up our iPhone and showed him that we could book it right now in the lobby on one of the many hotel sites. He said that we could sit in his lobby and book it on-line, but that he wouldn't be able to honor the reservation - even with a confirmation number until the reservation linked with his - which would be over two hours. Snidely he said - do you want to do that or would you like to book the room now at $139. I said to Brian that the external OTA's charge quite a fee and that actually the hotel would be doing better if he would just honor that lowest rate guarantee and provide good customer service to us and the hotel would save $25 to $30 in room revenue. That is when Brian used the greatest service line ever - "That's our policy". The entire check-in process was cold and unprofessinal. When we asked "tell us about this hotel" he said, what do you want to know... we asked tell us about it - it is unique and we really don't know much about it. He said, It's a hotel that was taken over from the Vance hotel chain and that they feature art here. That really told us some great stuff "Brian". There was no description of the room we were going to go in, the services of the hotel and anything else hospitable. The room was cold, although clean, but did not feel we got the value out of the experience. We would not stay here again - unless you are seeking a rude experience as your stay and a mediocre room to sleep - super small rooms. As we were so impressed with the service - there was a huge disconnect as to why the property had so much strange pictures everywhere. It wasn't until we read in the room that this was designed to be "artsy" in decor with some unique and signature pieces that we understood the theme. I guess "artsy" means rude and unprofessional. But as Brian said "that's our policy".

Reviews.Title: “Super cool art hotel that's not pretentious or obnoxious or over-run by hipsters.”
Reviews.Author: Bibliotheeka
Reviews.Content: -Tiny rooms that are well thought out. -Excellent and unusual amenities -Aveda products and plush towels -Feather pillows, down duvets, funky woollen blankets -Each room is individual - no ugly floral print bed spreads or boring mass produced pictures. -Love that an art catalogue is included with the amenities -Pillow menu and Spirituality menu (choose your religious reading materials) are quirky but appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, great style”
Reviews.Author: Christa4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first and last stop for my husband and I on our honeymoon. We are both in the arts, so it was great to find a place with such a great style and appreciate for art. Because it's an old dorm, the rooms are quite tight, though, so if you need space, this isn't the right choice. We were a bit disappointed because prior to our trip, all of our friends told us to mention it was our honeymoon where ever we went because people are very generous. We mentioned it and the staff could not have cared less. They were nice and all, but not generous. Not that we're the type to expect things to be given to us, we had just heard so many stories of couples who honeymooned before us and we seemed to draw the short straw with Hotel Max. So FYI - if you are looking for a honeymoon hotel and you like perks, Hotel Max isn't the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Max - In Brief”
Reviews.Author: travelerpdm
Reviews.Content: Excellent price, no fuss, great location, but the decorating style is bit cold

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the price but VERY SMALL”
Reviews.Author: amigorita
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Max three times and have been happy with each stay. The location is PERFECT! Right downtown! The only thing that I find negative about Hotel Max is how small everything is. The elevator can hardly fit two people plus luggage and the rooms are tiny. But they are very artistic and trendy which helps make up for the size.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and fun”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Max for 3 nights. The locations is great, close to everything. . .shopping, Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square. The bathrooms are very small and not enough storage or counter space to put your things, if you were planning to stay for a longer period. Also the cupboard was extremely small and would not hold a hanger properly. We had a small problem with Housekeeping. We had a couple of unopened bottles of water in the fridge also they provide a couple of wine glasses. The next day when we came back to our hotel room after shopping, they took our water along with the wine glasses. There was also no wash cloths. We went to the front desk to let them know of this problem. It took 24 hours before they replaced the items. They compensated us for this inconvenience by taking $50 off our bill. Would I go back and stay at the Max; definately!

Reviews.Title: “This arresting boutique hotel in downtown Seattle is the ONLY place to stay when busines takes you to Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: GoBrad
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max, with its central location, superb service and artsy/irreverent vibe is an absolute delight to stay in. It also has a fantastic in-house restaurant and reasonable prices. Don't take my word, GO!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel, great location, crisp design with original art, great price”
Reviews.Author: NCtxplt
Reviews.Content: Recommended by the group that invited me to a two day meeting. I was amazed by the thoroughly excellent experience I had while there. I will definitely return, hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “artsy hotel”
Reviews.Author: marivic_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend. Great place for diversion. I love the artwork especially the room doors. I was welcome to use their business room anytime. I also like their idea of lighting candles in the evening, they only not save energy but make the place cozy and homey. It is right in the heart of downtown, it's walking distance to shopping center, monorail and at the market. The only downside is their shower room. It's too tiny. I wonder how a tall person can fit in there.

Reviews.Title: “Experience New York in Seattle's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: pangeaman
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to the hotel Max. I stay here about twice a year in this boutique New York style hotel. The hotels location is perfect and is well equipped with a gym, business center and sushi resturant. If you are looking for an outstaning experience (staff, location and rooms) then book yourself into the MAX. There are plenty of Paul Allen resturants in the area, malls, Pike Place Market and SAM are 10 min walk, Jazz Alley is a great venue for a night out and these are all in walking distance. I also suggest a jog down to Alaskan Way and over to Olympic Sculpture Park. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, upbeat hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: shauna1767
Reviews.Content: Efficient, friendly staff. Chic decor. Great products/services/stuff. Excellent value. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Mind Coming Back - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kerche
Reviews.Content: Snagged a really good deal on Priceline.com for a same day check-in (arrived to Seattle late at night). Didn't have much time to check online on what Hotel Max was like, so was a little surprised at first to see it was a small boutique hotel. No biggie! I caught a shared van from SeaTac airport to the Westin hotel, and walked a block up (saved more money than a curb-side drop off at Hotel Max!) The hotel hallways were pretty neat & really loved the artwork on the doors of the rooms. PROS: - The room size with a king bed was comfortable enough for me as a solo traveler - COMFORTABLE BED!!!! It's on the soft side, but I love it. There were plenty of pillows to go around, so that was nice too - LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Quick 1 block walk to the shopping complex (forget the name) that has a Nordstrom/Barney's attached and other high-end stores - Starbucks across the street! - Walk to "Pike Place Public Market" wasn't too far. Around 10-15mins? - Friendly and helpful staff - Luggage storage for late departures out of Seattle - Check-out time was 12 noon I believe. Perfect! CONS: - Shower size: I'm a very petite 5'1" and even I felt rather cramped while showering! You can easily bang on the walls if not careful..... so you feel rather restricted to shower (like on a cruise ship) - Sink area: While I like a glass bowl for a sink, it wasn't helpful at all for a female when it comes to washing my face. Easily get yourself wet! There was also a glass shelf directly above it, and while it's useful....it didn't help that when I lowered my head to wash my face, I could easily knock the top of my head on the shelf if I wasn't careful!!!! That would've been a big OUCH - No lighting in the area when you first walk in through the doors, and with gray-colored walls....it was pretty dark! Also no lighting in the closet so it was hard to see. There's ample lighting with 2 bedside lamps, a desk lamp and ceiling light above the bed....so it isn't too shabby - Room Temperature: The heater/AC system attached to the window is rather finicky to use. It's really loud when you turn it on for heat, but if you don't leave it on - the room gets cold really fast (esp for a winter's night). You can also feel a draft from the windows, so it didn't help. I had to turn off the heater at night because it was too loud, so I ended up slightly freezing but I did warm up underneath the covers - Can be a noisy room from the traffic during the day (especially)/night. Kind of similar to the sounds of NYC Overall I wouldn't mind coming back for a night or two in the future, but with females! Hahaha. I would say that guys will have a tougher time, especially in the bathroom...considering the size of it!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE”
Reviews.Author: danna_alexandra
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from start to finish! We were greeted promptly at our vehicle and helped to unload our bags and the valet takes your car for overnight parking if you'd like ($30, seems standard for hotels in Seattle). We were allowed to check in early and were very impressed with how stylish the lobby and halls were. We stayed in the corner room on the 7th floor (707) which had an excellent view of the Space Needle. The bed was comfortable and the pillows are unmatched by any hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms were stylish and functional, although the bathroom was a little small. We forgot a pair of shoes in the car that had been valet parked by the hotel and a member of the staff offered to retrieve them for us, we truly appreciated the service we received. There is a delicious sushi restaurant attached to the hotel which we highly recommend, I think it was called "Red Fin?" The location is amazing, only a few blocks from Pike Place Market, the Space Needle and what was #1 on our trip, QWEST Field. 2 thumbs up for Hotel Max!

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: debbiegrant
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beds are very comfortable, great location, and Starbucks is next door. Cons: Rooms and bathrooms are extremely small. Similiar to cruise ship size rooms. The elevators could hold no more than four adults, and even four is pushing it. The ventilation in the room was horrible. It was either to hot or to cold. We could never get it to a comfortable tempature.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Max”
Reviews.Author: speckled_one
Reviews.Content: We've booked here 2 years in a row now and absolutely love this hotel. The location can't be beat, the decor is fabulous and the service is always positive. The only minus with this place is that (and what) they charge for wifi. It's a service that costs them relatively little - so it's ridiculous that it's not a free service like it is so many other places. We go across the street to Starbucks for free wifi (which brings our overall experience at Hotel Max down a notch). Other than that though, we love love love this place. The Red Fin next door also has some lovely sushi and is a great place to start the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with great location”
Reviews.Author: Marshall333
Reviews.Content: Hip, trendy hotel with a great location and knowledgeable staff. We would definitely return, and will be back again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Big service for a small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyT_11
Reviews.Content: Great staff! Stayed here for New Years Eve and the 2 days after. Such a friendly staff. The hotel bar/restuarant was a great place as well. Really liked how the hotel was done. Very contemporary look and feel. Had issues with the room that we were put into. It was very small compared to other hotels I have stayed at. Felt like it was just the extra space they decided to turn into a room. The view was not good,it was of the back alley. I would suggest getting a room that faces the street so that you can have a better view of Seattle. The bed was very comfortable so that made up for the size. The bathroom was very small as well. The shower was a one-person with a curtain that was more of a cloth that just barely reached the floor. The happy hour in the bar was priced reasonably well. The spice of the food was pretty spicy for my taste and I'm a person who likes food to be spicy. The location I thought would be closer to the Space Needle and Pike Market. The market is a little far to walk unless it's a warm day in Seattle., it's worth the walk. Same for the Space Needle. The value was relatively high but for downtown it was expected. Again like I said, for the cost I was hoping for a bigger room. The staff made up the cost by being fast and extremely friendly, all the way from the valet, bell person, front desk to room-service. Pretty much everyone we encountered that was on the clock was most hospitible I have ever experienced in any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: elaybourn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Max twice, and had great experiences both times. Parking at the hotel is super easy and all the staff are very friendly and attentive. My only complaints are with the size of the rooms/bathrooms, but that only applies to the most recent stay. The first time I had a pretty big room, but this last time it seemed the room shrunk by half. At the end of the day this is not a huge problem since the room is really only there for me to shower and sleep in, if I were living out of it, that would be a diferent story. Overall great experience and I will defeinitely be going back. Ohh and I forgot to mention the location; it is perfect for the person(s) who want to see all of downtown Seattle (Pikes, Space Needl, shopping) and don't mind walking. One night of parking at the Max is cheaper than a few hours of parking anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Service-oriented, comfortable and convenient. Excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: RickCVan
Reviews.Content: One night stay to see Picasso exhibit at SAM. Close to shopping, good food. Very comfortable room for a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Excellent Art, Well Priced, but Cold!”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our weeknight stay, on an overnight trip to Seattle from Portland. I was especially interested in the hotel's original Northwest art collection. The decor and interior design overall were distinctive and welcoming. The staff was friendly and helpful. And Red Fin the sushi, etc. restaurant adjacent was very good. The room we stayed in was on the 10th floor, with windows on two corners. The views and overall appearance of the room were great. To our surprise, the internet access was not free. The bathroom layout was very cramped, but generally functional. Our primary disappointment was how cold the room was. The December outdoor temperatures were in the 20s and 30s, and the room felt not much warmer than that when we arrived. The windows appeared to not have double panes, and minimal weather stripping, so drafts were very evident. The only heating unit struggled to warm the space, and never fully succeeded. Happily, the duvet on the bed was warm, so sleep wasn't too cold. My husband and I are in our 30s and generally like a cool climate, but this room was a shocker. I would likely go back, preferably in warmer weather, and would request the heat be turned on before I arrived if it's a winter visit.

Reviews.Title: “European Boutique Hotel = overpriced, undersized”
Reviews.Author: KommissarKen
Reviews.Content: Postage-stamped sized rooms, with even tinier bathrooms. Sitting on the toiler, my chin touched the sink. Traveled with a friend so we wanted two beds. The hotel upcharged us $35 for a second bed. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here almost two weeks in November - very restful.”
Reviews.Author: wantingbetterservice
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Max has taken an older property and provided a fun flair. The doormen and front desk are very friendly and willing to help. The rooms are a tad small, but for business travel that is alright. The biggest drawback I saw was the manual thermostat on the heating/cooling unit. I would have preferred a wall-mount thermostat. The Internet quality was average. VPN was sometimes difficult due to latency from their Internet provider.

Reviews.Title: “Very swank hotel! And perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AdventuresRus51
Reviews.Content: Location was awesome! Perfect for walking to wherever you want; shops, Pike Place Market. Love the valet parking and the valet staff was fun and quick. Liked the fact the floors are secure via your key. Our room was the smallest of our group but we had a great view of the Space Needle and mountains and it definitely served its purpose. The bed was very cozy. Loved the decor in room and hallways. The front desk staff were very helpful and proactive. Unfortunately didn't take advantage of the two happy hours next door at Red Fin but we did have a great breakfast there!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: alexbunardzic
Reviews.Content: I personally don't like having to spend time in hotels, but Hotel Max in Seattle is the first time ever that I've truly enjoyed my stay. Incredible value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Never again - cold rooms and poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jack_n_Russ
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a hotel where the room was cold! We had to blast the heating device which still didn't heat the bathroom. The in-window heater/AC unit (think Motel 6) was so loud we couldn't get a good night sleep even on a king size bed. Staff kindly moved us to another room the following night with a newer heater/AC, but it was still noisy. To top it off the bathtub had mould on the walls, but at least we had a bathtub, the first room didn't. Asking for something from the front desk was a comedy of errors and staff were rarely there to open the front door. This is one of the reasons not to book non-refundable rooms as we were there for three sleepless nights.

Reviews.Title: “The hippest little hotel in Seattle WA”
Reviews.Author: themaxSeattle
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location, near shopping, nightlife and dining. Great service and friendly staff, easy parking (valet) and the hotel is user friendly and "SMART"!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfy and high attention to details”
Reviews.Author: cityslickin
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and incredibly comfortable beds. The bathroom was kind of small but the Aveda products made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Tickled Pink”
Reviews.Author: janosky74
Reviews.Content: Our experience from the start of the reservation until our checkout was TOP NOTCH! The cleanliness of the Hotel Max and the extremely courteous, ( but not to overly accomodating or anxious), staff made this one of the most relaxed and easy going overnight city stays we have had in a very long time! We did not eat at The Fin Restaurant, but we are looking forward to it in the future! The location of the Hotel was within 2 blocks of great Seattle Shopping and we felt relatively safe going to and from the Pacific Place Shopping Plaza. On the other hand, it was NOT so nice and safe heading up 2 blocks towards the bus station. But this is not a reflection on the Hotel Max establishment. Safety, coffee, shopping, great food, and an amazing Hotel and staff made this an experience we can't wait to repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, Trendy historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Superjungleboy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick trip down the coast to Seattle, we stayed right downtown at Hotel Max as an alternate to our usual Pan Pacific, and were very pleased with a great stay there. The rooms are very well decorated with art by local Seattle artists, a fantastic idea! The beds and rooms were very comfortable and sleep quality was terrific. The building is a renovated historic building, they kept a lot of the great original (I believe) features of the building in both exterior and interior. That being said the floor plans didn't leave for much space in the bathroom, but neither of us minded, it had a nice soaker tub though. :) The desk and bell staff were great hosts, and it was really impressive that the GM emails you post stay to check up. Would definately return and recommend this hotel to others looking for something trendy in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Boutique Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max was everything that I thought it would be: fun, hip, sassy, and most importantly, convenient. The hotel was in walking distance of the office where I was working, and a quick trip to the waterfront, as well. While my room was small, it was nicely appointed, and the bed was quite comfortable. The bathroom, however, was almost impossibly tiny; I could barely turn around in the shower. I understand that not all rooms have tiny bathrooms, so be sure to ask for a room with a larger bathroom. It was everything I wanted in a boutique hotel in Seattle. The restaurant, Red Fin, was a also a nice surprise for a hotel restaurant. The food was excellent, and the bar a nice gathering place. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Best city hotel I have stayed at in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Puffms
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location; resposnive and knowledgeable staff: front desk, cobcierge and valet; minimal and well laid out rooms; comfortable beds; quiet rooms for a central city location; walking distance to pike place markets, monorail,amjor shopping ecntres and seattle central is a 15 minute walk; value for money; overall and very comfortable feel and no over-the-top frills or signage about how good thier pillos are; check the "yep" and "nope" door hangers - well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “A most positive experience”
Reviews.Author: getshorty1
Reviews.Content: This is great little boutique hotel. The rooms are very well appointed, not large but very comfortable. The updates are certainly notable. If there is a downside, it would be the size of the bathroom. It was small, but not impossible. The location is excellent for shopping, a short walk (5 min.) and you are at Westlake Plaza, Macy's and the downtown stores. The food at the restaurant (Japenese) is excellent and well presented. The staff at the hotel are pleasant and very helpful. Definitely will stay there again........

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room and Bathroom I've ever been in.”
Reviews.Author: sarah_bagdon
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was tiny. The bathroom and shower was so small I was unable to dry off in the bathroom. I had to step out of the bathroom to dry off. The bathroom was the same size as an airplane bathroom. There was poor lighting in the room and only one mini mirror in the bathroom, Could not put my make up on in the bathroom, mirror to small. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jcarolgentry
Reviews.Content: From the service to the uniqueness of decor and rooms, Aveda toiletries, and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff made our stay very enjoyable will return there whenever we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with little rooms”
Reviews.Author: happy_go_lucky_guy
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to need an extra person working the front desk, as the one person who was working was swamped. The rooms are quite small, but the amenities weren't bad. Nice selection of coffee and teas, as well as a large flatscreen TV and a computer desk. The wifi worked fine. There were not enough plug ins, which was quite irritating. The bathroom, while iddy biddy, was actually kinda cute. Most importantly, the bed was VERY comfortable and I slept soundly. I also ate in the restaurant, and I thought it was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Artsy Getaway”
Reviews.Author: sageart
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max IS the max! What a perfect experience for our weekend art get-away. The artsy decor tickled our fancy --- from the original wall canvas paintings to the illustrated room doors with the "nope and yups" to the chic colorful interiors of the room --- we loved it totally! (not to mention that you are just hop and skip away from Tula's and the Crocodile) Special thanks to the female desk clerk who was very helpful with a room change at checkin. And the door guy who was thoughtful enough to suggest and provide an umbrella! We WILL be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown choice, especially with cruise parking pkg”
Reviews.Author: jeane00
Reviews.Content: If you're driving to Seattle for a cruise, you quickly discover parking is a sizable cost while you're on board the ship. Hotel Max was offering a terrific deal: stay for one night minimum, and you could leave your car in their secure valet pkg for the full week! The upcharge was a mere $79, compared to the $18/day the cruise line was going to charge us for a public parking lot - not ideal when we were leaving half our stuff stored in the car. Rooms are small, downtown is its usual noisy self with buses and car traffic, and the bathrooms are miniscule. I mean really tiny - the bathroom on board the ship was bigger! Nonetheless, we knew it would be noisy downtown, the room was fine and the beds were excellent, and that parking deal is phenomenal. Plus, the hotel threw in a complimentary town car out to the ship! This was unexpected and was a wonderful freebie we weren't expecting. Good location, very close to the Tom Douglas restaurants which are some of our favs to eat at. Be aware the color scheme is dark gray, black and red. You'll need a flashlight to find the step up to the bathroom without stubbing your toe!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome..after I checked in.”
Reviews.Author: artleonardo
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Hotel is awesome my only complaint was that upon arriving to check in I was told that there was going to be a $75 dollar charge to my card, that really seems extreme and missing leading. Coming to the city with only a certain about of money doesn't permit such charges,if I had known forehand I would have not come to Hotel Max. Thankfully the Agent was able to help me by cutting back the extra amenities. Thank you for that, my trip would have been ruined besides the fact I prepaid for the entire cost of the room. Will I return? Yes I want to say I will although a $75 charge after booking the room and paying all up front costs makes me hesitant to return...where is that policie written?

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in great locations”
Reviews.Author: Vegastravel2000
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the minute we checked in. Staff was very friendly and the location of the hotel was perfect. We were also very fond of the decor and vibe of the hotel. The room was small but it was very nice. We were very pleased and will be staying here whenever we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little getaway”
Reviews.Author: EMA375
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max was in the ideal location to Pike's Place Market and various restaurants in downtown Seattle. The friendly staff guided us to fantastic restaurants, in the area, and must-see things to do. Yes, the rooms are small. But, we didn't fly to Seattle to see the rooms. And, don't miss out on the breakfast and Red Fin!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Honeymoon Trip EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: NeoDreamer77
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We were walking distance to everything we wanted to see. 15 min walk to the space needle, less than 10 min walk to pikes market place. The staf was great and had awesome advice/suggestions for visiting thier beautiful city. As for the price well my wife and I got a discount since she works for the gap inc, but we would go back even without it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel in the heart of Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: cb12320
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just as the pictures showed... loved our room (10th floor).. although it was small.. but the colors and decorating were awesome. Bed was very comfortable with great pillows! Bathroom was smaller stilll ... but it was very cute none the less... I found the staff to be very helpful and polite.. The location was great... have to valet park at $30 a day... We didnt hear any of our neighbors... just the garbage truck at night and the sirens... but you will hear that anywhere there. Overall... it was exactly as I was hoping it would be..

Reviews.Title: “Mother & Father of the Bride loved the service.”
Reviews.Author: Patti10-10
Reviews.Content: They have a wedding rate for family and friends and the location is great for downtown Seattle events.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small”
Reviews.Author: LAXbuzz
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and they had blinds on the windows with no curtains, so it was very bright and it felt very chilly in the room as the bed is right next to the window and the windows needed to have double pane so it was noisy too. The service was good though. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an Artist Buisness trip .. almost perfect but pricey minibar!”
Reviews.Author: siempreengira
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NICE , i went there for a performance buisnees trip , arrived after a 15 hour plane trip , really needed my rest before my show , they did not have the room i was booked in on the 9th floor ready so they offered me a room in the 2nd floor , i was told i could change it in 2 hours if i did not like it.Very friendly Staff. I accepted it , the room did not have a view but was very quiet so it was perfect for me , the bed was so nice!! just like the pillows , the minbar was extremely expensive but well worth it as it had an amazing amount of choices ...Minibars are always expensive anyways!The bathrooms are small but also nice that the toilett is separated to the bathroom , bath products are also great .. my only complain the AC was very near the bed and was very noisy , i did turn it off but the noise continued , it was white noise so not so much of a problem , but i did not understand why when turning off the machine still sounded ... the decoration of the hotel is also nice , is modern and perfect for artists on the road or young -middle aged modern couples.. My friends had sushi and drinks and they rated them quite high as well.. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and odd rooms. Did I mention that it's tiny?”
Reviews.Author: jasonx
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I have been slacking for a couple years with writing reviews but felt compelled after a couple nights at the Hotel Max. Also, we planned this trip very last minute so I didnâ€™t get a chance to go through as many reviews as I would have liked before we booked. Well, this hotel does have some good things going for it, but none of them could outweigh the negatives enough to recommend this place to anyone. One, yeah the rooms are small. This was pretty much the joke of our trip. The bathroom size is reminiscent of those in an airplane or RV. I'm not a huge guy, 5'9", 155, and it was nearly impossible to stand in the shower without touching one of the walls. But a positive about the size, you can brush your teeth, use the toilet, and take a shower from standing in one spot. The room itself is nicely appointed but TINY â€“ even by European standards. No real dresser to put clothes in and nowhere to sit except for the bed. There is a desk chair but really unusable due to the size of the room. Beds are very soft, which my girlfriend liked, but I woke up with a sore back both mornings we were there. The other off putting thing about the room aside from the size, was the main piece of artwork that appeared to be an abstract of a shirtless male with a ball gag in his mouth (see pic). Weâ€™re not prudes but not really into that either. On that note we chose not to purchase the $30 Intimacy Kit w/ â€œIntimacyâ€� ring from the mini bar. After we got there we wished we would have booked the Westin a couple blocks away or somewhere down on the waterfront. But the Max was tolerable for a couple nights and we had a great time in Seattle. Kells Irish Pub was a good time and the clam chowder was great everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overated. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.”
Reviews.Author: mahiwahoo
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled like wet dog. Rooms were pokey, dark with masculine urban depressing overtones. Aircon noisy. I definately would not class this as a boutique hotel with open space and fresh minimalist lines. If you're bipolar do not go to this hotel! It certainly is boutique in that it is literally small in size. Marketing spin maybe appealing to arty urbanite market...but for us it just didn't quite gel in the execution. Some pleasant aspects of the Max hotel were a couple of paintings in the lobby, its central downtown location, and courteous staff. You can find better hotels for the price and eye candy. Try Mariott Courtyard Pioneer Square.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, lively hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BodBodLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Max was a great base from which to explore Seattle, being walking distance from all the main attractions. The staff were friendly and helpful and the decor was cool without being OTT (particularly loved the Nirvana doors!). We'd recommend it to anyone looking for a fun, convenient, trendy place to stay but not perhaps to anyone wanting a quiet time. The road is a bit noisy and because the hotel seems to attract a youngish crowd (20s - 40s) there can be noise in the corridors until late. But don't let this put you off! Take your ear plugs and enjoy. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic relaxing night celebrating our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: taniainseattle
Reviews.Content: Great dinner and drinks at Redfin Small but really just the right sized room - with a painting we loved and view of the city Fantastic sleep in a very comfortable bed Slept in, room service for breakfast for a lovely lazy morning

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with awesome service at a competitive rate”
Reviews.Author: Iminvaldez
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel because there were no rooms avaiable at the Westin. It was less expensive, a beautiful room with a great view and the service was truly awesome. They exceeded my expectations and I while I am not usually a "recommender " I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in the centre of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kat-liz10
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Yes the rooms are small but as I was travelling alone it wasn't a problem for me. The hotel rooms are really nicely decorated, and I loved all the artwork on the hotel room doors, all individual. The bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in, I usually have difficulty sleeping in unfamiliar hotel rooms but I slept incredibly well here, so much so that I came back to this hotel after a 2-week trip to Canada. I should have been staying elsewhere in the city on my return to Seattle but decided to return here knowing how comfortable and clean it was. The staff were very friendly and helpful with any enquiries that I had and the location was excellent - great for exploring the centre of Seattle. I didn't eat in the restaurant next door but had a couple of drinks at the bar chatting to a couple of locals which was nice! I would have no hesitation staing here again.

Reviews.Title: “One SEXY Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scott_R60
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was S-E-X-Y. From the Card & Fortune Cookie, to the art, style and layout of the facility...this place is artsy, chic and sexy! The staff was amazing and the bottom line is the Hotel Max is a 100% class act!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun ambiance, super...”
Reviews.Author: Workinfool
Reviews.Content: Great location, fun ambiance, super comfortable beds, good value overall

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay (Great Location for Federal Jury Duty)”
Reviews.Author: nwlaurakathryn
Reviews.Content: I was called for jury duty and looked for an affordable and nice hotel near the Federal District Court. Hotel Max was perfect.
